ingredients: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch pieces
cookingMethod: Heat the oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
Add the chicken and cook until browned on all sides.
Add the onion and cook until softened.
Add the tomatoes, ginger garlic paste, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala powder, and salt.
Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add 1 cup of water and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.
Garnish with cilantro and mint.
Wash the rice and lentils in cold water until the water runs clear.
In a large pot or Dutch oven, combine the rice, lentils, onion, tomatoes, ginger garlic paste, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala powder, and salt.
Add 3 cups of water and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes, or until the rice and lentils are cooked through.
Garnish with cilantro.
Marinate the fish with turmeric powder and salt. Set aside for 15 minutes.
Heat mustard oil in a pan and fry the fish until golden brown. Remove and keep aside.
In the same pan, add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, and spices. Cook for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft.
Add water and bring it to a boil. Then, simmer for 5 minutes.
Gently slide in the fried fish and cook for another 5 minutes.
Serve hot with steamed rice or roti.
Heat oil in a pan and sauté sliced onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies. Cook for a minute.
Add chicken pieces and cook until they turn white.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft.
Add water if needed and simmer until the chicken is cooked and the gravy thickens.
Serve hot with rice or roti.

ingredients: 1 pound mixed vegetables, such as potatoes, carrots, cauliflower, and green beans
cookingMethod: Wash the vegetables and cut them into bite-sized pieces.
Heat the oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
Add the onion and cook until softened.
Add the vegetables and cook until they are tender.
Add the ginger garlic paste, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala powder, and salt.
Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Serve hot with rice or roti.

ingredients: 4 large potatoes, peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes
cookingMethod: Heat the oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
Add the potatoes and cook until they are golden brown on all sides.
Remove the potatoes from the pot and set aside.
Add the onion to the pot and cook until softened.
Add the tomatoes, ginger garlic paste, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala powder, and salt.
Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the potatoes back to the pot and stir to coat.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender.
Serve hot with rice or roti.
In a large bowl, combine the puffed rice, onion, tomatoes, ginger garlic paste, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala powder, and salt.
Add the cilantro, mint, green chilies, lemon juice, and mustard oil.
Mix well and serve immediately.
In a large saucepan, heat the milk over medium heat.
Once the milk comes to a boil, reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes, or until the milk has reduced by half.
Add the sugar and lemon juice and stir until the sugar has dissolved.
Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the rose water.
Drop the hot milk mixture into a bowl of cold water.
Once the balls have cooled, they are ready to be served.

ingredients: 1/4 teaspoon saffron, dissolved in 1 tablespoon warm water
cookingMethod: In a large bowl, combine the semolina, milk, sugar, cardamom powder, and saffron water.
Mix well and let stand for 30 minutes.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the semolina mixture and cook, stirring constantly, until it is golden brown and cooked through.
Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the almonds and pistachios.
Serve hot.
In a large saucepan, heat the milk over medium heat.
Once the milk comes to a boil, reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes, or until the milk has reduced by half.
Add the rice and sugar and stir until the rice is cooked through.
Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the cardamom powder.
Serve hot.
Heat the oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
Add the beef and cook until browned on all sides.
Remove the beef from the pot and set aside.
Add the onion to the pot and cook until softened.
Add the tomatoes, ginger garlic paste, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala powder, and salt.
Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the beef back to the pot and stir to coat.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 1 hour, or until the beef is tender.
Garnish with cilantro and serve hot with rice or roti.
In a large saucepan, heat the milk over medium heat.
Once the milk comes to a boil, reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes, or until the milk has reduced by half.
Add the rice and sugar and stir until the rice is cooked through.
Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the chicken and cardamom powder.
Serve hot.
Wash the rice and lentils in cold water until the water runs clear.
In a large pot or Dutch oven, combine the rice, lentils, mutton, onion, tomatoes, ginger garlic paste, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala powder, and salt.
Add 3 cups of water and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes, or until the rice and lentils are cooked through.
Garnish with cilantro and serve hot.
Wash the rice in cold water until the water runs clear.
In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat 1 tablespoon of oil over medium heat.
Add the chicken and cook until browned on all sides.
Remove the chicken from the pot and set aside.
Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil to the pot and heat over medium heat.
Add the onion and cook until softened.
Add the tomatoes, ginger garlic paste, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala powder, and salt.
Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the rice and chicken back to the pot and stir to coat.
Add 3 cups of water and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes, or until the rice is cooked through.
Garnish with cilantro and serve hot.

ingredients: 1 cup basmati rice, soaked for 30 minutes
cookingMethod: In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat 1 tablespoon of mustard oil over medium heat.
Add the chicken and cook until browned on all sides.
Remove the chicken from the pot and set aside.
Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of mustard oil to the pot and heat over medium heat.
Add the onion and cook until softened.
Add the tomatoes, ginger garlic paste, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala powder, and salt.
Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the chicken back to the pot and stir to coat.
Add the yogurt, lemon juice, cilantro, mint, and rice.
Mix well and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes, or until the rice is cooked through.
Garnish with cilantro and serve hot.
In a large bowl, combine the rice, onion, tomatoes, cucumber, green chili, chickpeas, potatoes, eggs, cilantro, mint, lemon juice, mustard oil, salt, and black pepper.
Mix well and serve chilled.

ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables, such as potatoes, carrots, cauliflower, and green beans
cookingMethod: Heat the oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
Add the onion and cook until softened.
Add the tomatoes, ginger garlic paste, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala powder, and salt.
Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the vegetables and vegetable broth.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
Garnish with cilantro and serve hot.
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the chicken and cook until browned on all sides.
Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
Add the onion and cook until softened.
Add the tomatoes, ginger garlic paste, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala powder, and salt.
Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the chicken back to the skillet and stir to coat.
Transfer the chicken to a baking dish and bake for 30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.
Garnish with cilantro and serve hot.
In a large saucepan, heat the milk over medium heat.
Once the milk comes to a boil, reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes, or until the milk has reduced by half.
Add the rice and sugar and stir until the rice is cooked through.
Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the cardamom powder.
Serve hot.

ingredients: 1 cup red kidney beans, soaked overnight
cookingMethod: Drain the kidney beans and rinse them well.
Heat the oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
Add the onion and cook until softened.
Add the tomatoes, ginger garlic paste, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala powder, and salt.
Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the kidney beans and 2 cups of water.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes, or until the kidney beans are tender.
Garnish with cilantro and serve hot.
Heat the oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
Add the chicken and cook until browned on all sides.
Remove the chicken from the pot and set aside.
Add the onion and cook until softened.
Add the tomatoes, ginger garlic paste, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala powder, and salt.
Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the chicken back to the pot and stir to coat.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.
Garnish with cilantro and serve hot.
